product_uin.description: Unique Identification Number of the product

product_type.value: Non-Linked, Non-Participating, Individual, Pure Risk Premium/Savings Life Insurance Plan
product_type.description: Type of the insurance product (e.g., Term, ULIP, Endowment)

plan_description.value: A Non-Linked, Non-Participating, Individual, Pure Risk Premium/Savings Life Insurance Plan that covers COVID-19 claims, offers life cover, critical illness cover, income payouts from age 60, and options to adjust premium payment terms.
plan_description.description: Key features of the insurance product

plan_options.value:
1. **Life & CI Rebalance**: Aims to balance between Death and Critical Illness benefits. Critical Illness cover increases annually with a corresponding reduction in Life Cover. Future premiums are waived on detection of covered Critical Illnesses, and life cover continues.

2. **Life Protect**: Provides a lump sum on the death of the life assured.

3. **Income Plus**: Covers the Life Assured for the entire policy term, provides a lump sum payout on maturity, and regular income starting from age 60.
plan_options.description: Plan options available under the HDFC Life Click 2 Protect Life policy with brief descriptions.

3. Income Plus - Under this plan option, the Life Assured is covered for the entire policy 
term and also receives a lump sum payout on maturity along with regular income 
starting from age 60.
You may choose one of the above plan options at inception of the policy. Plan option 
once selected cannot be changed during the Policy Term. Benefits under each option

and Critical Illness benefit as you go along in your life. Critical Illness cover increases 
at each policy anniversary with corresponding reduction in Life Cover. In addition, all 
future premiums are waived off on detection of any of the covered Critical Illnesses 
and the life cover continues.

Benefit on diagnosis of Critical Illness:
On diagnosis of any of the covered critical illnesses, the applicable Critical Illness (CI) SA 
at the time of diagnosis of the disease, will be payable to you.
In addition, all future premiums payable under the plan will be waived off and the life 
cover continues.
Please refer the section on “Critical Illnesses covered” for list of Critical Illnesses covered

Exclusions for Critical Illness Benefit
Apart from the disease specific exclusions given along with definitions of diseases 
above, no benefit will be payable if the critical illness is caused or aggravated directly 
or indirectly by any of the following:
• Diagnosis of any of the listed critical illness and/or hospitalization and/or treatment 
(availed or advised) within 90 days of the risk commencement date or reinstatement 
date whichever is later.

other_benefits.value:
1. **Accidental Death Benefit (ADB) Option**: Provides an additional amount equal to 100% of Basic Sum Assured to the Nominee on the Life Assured’s death due to an accident during the policy term. Requires an additional premium.

2. **Return of Premium (ROP) Option**: Offers a return of 100% of the Total Premiums Paid as a lump sum upon survival until maturity. Available for policy terms between 10 and 40 years for Single, Regular, and 5 Pay, and between 15 and 40 years for 8, 10, and 12 Pay. Requires an additional premium.

3. **Waiver of Premium on CI (WOP CI) Option**: Waives all future premiums if the life assured is diagnosed with any covered critical illnesses. Requires an additional premium.

4. **Alteration of Premium Payment Frequency**: Allows alteration of the premium payment frequency during the premium payment term without any charge/fee.

5. **Option to Reduce Premium Payment Term**: Allows reduction of Premium Payment Term from Regular Pay to Limited Pay.

1. Return of Premium (ROP) option
You may choose to opt for this benefit under plan option as per below table:
If you choose this plan option, you will have to pay an additional premium over and 
above the premium payable for the base plan option chosen and you will receive a

return of 100% of the Total Premiums Paid as a lump sum, upon survival until maturity. 
This add-on option will be available for:
All policy terms between 10 and 40 years for Single, Regular and 5 Pay.
 All policy terms between 15 and 40 years for 8, 10 and 12 Pay.
 2. Waiver of Premium on CI (WOP CI) Option 
If you choose this add-on option, all future premiums payable under the plan will be 
waived, if you, the life assured are diagnosed with any of the covered critical illnesses.

death_benefit_payment_option.value:
1. **Death Benefit** is payable as a lump sum to the Nominee if the Life Assured dies during the policy term.
2. The **Death Benefit** is the higher of:
   - **Sum Assured on Death**
   - **105% of Total Premiums Paid**
   - **Life Cover SA**
3. **Sum Assured on Death** for **Single Pay (SP)** is the highest of:
   - **125% of Single Premium**
   - **Sum Assured on Maturity**
   - **Basic Sum Assured**
4. **Sum Assured on Death** for other than **Single Pay (Limited Pay and Regular Pay)** is the highest of:
   - **10 times of the Annualized Premium**
   - **Sum Assured on Maturity**
5. The **Death Benefit** is reduced by the total **Survival Benefits** paid out till the date of death.

instant_cash_benefit.value:
1. **Lump Sum Benefit on Death**: On the death of the Life Assured, a lump sum benefit of ₹71,00,000 is paid out to the Nominee.
2. **Critical Illness Benefit**: Upon diagnosis of a Critical Illness, the policy terminates, and future premiums are waived off.
3. **Income Plus Option**: Monthly income payouts start from the policy anniversary following the 60th birthday of the Life Assured and continue until death or policy maturity.

surrender_benefits.value:
1. **Surrender Benefits** for the **Income Plus Option** or **Return of Premium Option** are determined by the **Unexpired Risk Premium Value**, which is the higher of the **Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV)** and the **Special Surrender Value (SSV)**.

2. **Unexpired Risk Premium Value** is acquired immediately upon payment of premium in case of **Single Pay** and upon payment of premiums for 2 years in case of **Limited Pay** or **Regular Pay**.

3. **Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV)** is calculated as **GSV Factor%** multiplied by **Total Premiums Paid** minus **Survival Benefits** or **ROP instalment Already Paid**. The GSV will be floored to 0.

4. The company may pay a surrender value higher than the GSV in the form of a **Special Surrender Value (SSV)**.

5. **SSV** becomes payable after the completion of the first policy year provided one full year premium is paid.

surrender_value_factor.value:
1. **Policy Cancellation Value (PCV)**: Acquired immediately upon payment of premium in case of Single Pay (SP) and upon payment of premiums for at least 1 full year and after completion of the first policy year in case of Limited Pay (LP).

2. **Guaranteed Surrender Value (GSV)**: Calculated as GSV Factor% x Total Premiums Paid - Survival Benefits or Return of Premium (ROP) installment already paid. The GSV will be floored to 0.

3. **Special Surrender Value (SSV)**: May be paid by the company if it is higher than the GSV. SSV becomes payable after completion of the first policy year provided one full year premium is paid.

exit_options.value:
1. **Return of Premium (ROP) Benefit**: Offers a return of 100% of the Total Premiums Paid as a lump sum upon survival until maturity. This option is available for all policy terms between 10 and 40 years for Single, Regular, and 5 Pay, and between 15 and 40 years for 8, 10, and 12 Pay.

2. **Waiver of Premium on Critical Illness (WOP CI) Option**: If the life assured is diagnosed with any covered critical illnesses, all future premiums payable under the plan will be waived.

3. **Income Plus Option**: Provides life cover for the chosen policy term and regular monthly income.

rider_benefits.value:
1. **HDFC Life Health Plus Rider**: This is a Non-Linked, Non-Participating/Participating, Pure risk premium, Individual Health rider. It provides a **lump sum benefit** equivalent to the Rider Sum Assured upon diagnosis of any of the covered 60 Critical Illnesses. Alternatively, a **proportionate benefit** of the Rider Sum Assured is payable.

2. **HDFC Life Income Benefit on Accidental Disability Rider**: This is a Non-Linked, Non-Participating/Participating, Pure risk premium, Individual Life/Health rider. It offers a **proportionate benefit** of the Rider Sum Assured in case of accidental death or partial/total disability due to an accident. Additionally, it provides a benefit if diagnosed with cancer, as per the option chosen under this rider. **No maturity benefit** is payable under this rider.
